page.title: 13ST. LEONARD'S CHURCH
page.content: The oldest remaining building in Frankley parish is St.Leonard's Church which was built circa 1200AD.It is set well away from any town in the dairy farming part of old Frankley.It is used regularly for christenings, marriages and burials by the local community.The church and parish registers are rare in being complete from the year 1598.These show the occupations of Frankley people over the centuries.The majority were farm labourers and today most of the land is used for dairy and arable farming. Because of agricultural importance few of the people served in either of the two great wars this century.The vicar has importance in the community and visits both local schools and old peoples' homes.
